alert.note: Alert for Palo Verde Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Freeze Warning issued December 13 at 11:48AM PST until December 15 at 8:00AM PST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FREEZE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT MST /11 PM PST/ TONIGHT TO 9 AM MST /8 AM PST/ WEDNESDAY... ...FREEZE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT MST /11 PM PST/ WEDNESDAY NIGHT TO 9 AM MST /8 AM PST/ THURSDAY... * WHAT...Temperatures in the lower 30s expected for tonight and Wednesday night. * WHERE...In Arizona, Parker Valley, Central La Paz County, Gila River Valley, Tonopah Desert, Superior, Northwest Pinal County, Tonto Basin and Dripping Springs. In California, Palo Verde Valley. * WHEN...For the first Freeze Warning, from midnight MST/11 PM PST tonight to 9 AM MST/8 AM PST Wednesday. For the second Freeze Warning, from midnight MST/11 PM PST Wednesday night to 9 AM MST/8 AM PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions will kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
